original: HANSON, Karl Johan, Disponent, Karlshamn, f Gbg 13/8 83 av v.värden L H o Justina Hansson, gm Signe Åhström. 5 kl lärov. Anst öl el fmor 99—08, disp El AB Hj. Smith 09—25. Inneh eg el installat- o gross.fma, Karl Hanson El AB, Khn, sed. 25, vkst dir dta. Ag fastigh Kullavik, Hällaryd, Blek. V. ordf stdsflm o hamndir; ordf Khns hdlsfrn o högerfrn, v. ordf Blek luftsk.frb, ordf ds arb.utsk, ordf Khns scoutkårsråd, styr.led Tekn frn Kkrona, El-entrep.frns östra krets mfl. RVO; riksluftsk.frbs o Sv köpm.frbs ftjt g, Scoutfrbs Förbundslilja, Städ brand-stodsbol:s M f »Mod i fara o medborg nit», FinlM 39—40; Odd Fellow. Hobbies: Segling, fiske.
translated: HANSON, Karl Johan, Manager, Karlshamn, born in Gothenburg on August 13, 1883, son of a retired military officer, L H, and Justina Hansson, married to Signe Åhström. Completed 5 years of primary education. Employed at a brewery or distillery from 1899 to 1908, then worked as a manager at El AB Hj. Smith from 1909 to 1925. Became the owner of his own electrical installation and wholesale company, Karl Hanson El AB, in Karlshamn since 1925, and currently serves as the company's director of operations. Also involved in various positions such as vice chairman of the local film society and harbor director, chairman of the Karlshamn's Chamber of Commerce and the conservative party, vice chairman of the Blekinge Air Association, chairman of the local work committee, chairman of the Karlshamn scout corps council, and board member of the Technical Association in Karlskrona, the eastern district of the Electrical Contractor Association, and more. Awarded the Order of Vasa (RVO). Member of the national air force association and the Swedish Chamber of Commerce. Received the Scout Association's "Förbundslilja" (Federation Lily) and the City Fire Support Company's Medal of "Mod i fara o medborg nit" ("Courage in Danger and Civic Zeal"). Served as a Finnish military officer from 1939 to 1940. Also a member of the Odd Fellow society. Hobbies include sailing and fishing.
